name: Fresh Sliced News
tag_list: news, blogs, rss, readers, visual-interface, personalized-newspaper
overview:
Fresh Sliced News helps readers keep up-to-date with the latest news on the web and builds engagement and value for publishers. Fresh Sliced News launched in the TechCrunch50 DemoPit in September 2009 with an easy-to-use, multi-platform desktop application that enables any user to build a personalized newspaper from his or her favorite sources on the web.

Like traditional newspapers, the Fresh Sliced News desktop application gives items visual prominence corresponding to their importance â€“ as determined by taking into account the level of engagement a news story is receiving on the internet (gauged by third-party service PostRank) and the interests a user has demonstrated in the news he or she has previously chosen to read.

Reaching beyond a highly technical userbase, Fresh Sliced News brings the power and convenience of RSS subscription technology to any computer user comfortable with intuitive visual interfaces. Readers gain from an improved news-reading experience, including FSN’s visual prioritization features, while publishers benefit from consistently engaged readers whose loyalty can be harnessed in new ways.
